alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 8:13PM CDT until March 29 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Mississippi River At Baton Rouge affecting West Baton Rouge and East Baton Rouge Parishes. Mississippi River At Red River Landing affecting West Feliciana, East Baton Rouge and Pointe Coupee Parishes. For the Lower Mississippi River...including Red River Landing, Baton Rouge, Donaldsonville, Reserve, New Orleans...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Baton Rouge. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, River islands from Red River Landing downstream to Baton Rouge will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 35.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CDT Wednesday was 35.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage by early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.5 feet on 12/31/1982. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge
